page.title: 15WILDEN CHURCH CHOIR.
page.content: Monday evening, and time once more to practice for the coming wedding and Garden Party. We meet at a member's house rather than in church. It's more sociable, making it possible to down a sherry at the half way mark. We call ourselves the 'occasional' choir, singing only on special occasions eg. Xmas, Easter, Harvest, weddings etc. We don't boast any outstanding voices, but we're enthusiastic, and definitely improving. Our roars of laughter-the result of our efforts- are often heard echoing through the village. The deep bass voice of our choirmaster -solicitor husband of our headmistress -can be heard balancing the large number of soprano voices. Our ages range from 10 years to over 80 years. How's that for bridging the generation gap!
